intro: Delphinium confusum, commonly known as the confused larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces showy blue to purple flowers in late spring to early summer, arranged in racemes along the stem. Its leaves are compound, with lance-shaped leaflets that are often hairy and have a distinctive appearance. Delphinium confusum is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open meadows and woodland edges.
